page.title: 01South of Golspie
page.content: A third of the block is sea the outer Moray Firth. Golspie pier is in the N, used now only for a few lobster boats. To the S is Golspie Golf Course, a fine links course with the road to Littleferry running W of it. Balblair Wood, a plantation of mixed conifer and broadleaf trees, fills the SW corner. Between it and the A9 is good farmland growing fine crops of barley, oats, turnips, hay, potatoes. No crofts here, only farms of some size by local standards. They are Sutherland Estate farms. Drummuie Farm is run by a resident farmer as a training school for the pupils of Golspie High School (secondary school for all of Sutherland). The school's technical annexe is beside the farm.
